awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (FARGO paints a great American portrait of hell frozen over. Black comedy and white-knuckle suspense form an icy bond in the second year of Noah Hawley's anthology series. Kirsten Dunst and Patrick Wilson lead a deliciously deadpan ensemble in an escalating bloodbath, where chills and Midwestern cheer fall like a quiet snow.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2015 Winner AFI Award
awardEventDetails.for: TV Program of the Year
awardEventDetails.description: (FARGO argues that murder is a dish best served cold - particularly when paired with puckish pathos in Noah Hawley's spin-off of the Coen brothers' classic film. Here, small-town warmth, embodied by Allison Tolman's Deputy Molly Solverson, gives way to the frigid Minnesota winter and the bitter chill of human depravity. Completing this macabre needlepoint are Martin Freeman's milquetoast-turned-murderer and Billy Bob Thornton's hilariously haunting hit man.)

awardEventDetails.title: 2016 Winner Black Reel
awardEventDetails.for: Outstanding Supporting Actor, TV Movie or Limited Series

62 wins & 247 nominations

Bakelmun (foley editor) - Ben Schor (music editor) - Stefan Fraticelli (foley artist) - Jason Charbonneau (foley artist) (For East/West (2020))
2021 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Cinematography for a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie

AFI Awards, USA

2016 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(FARGO paints a great American portrait of hell frozen over. Black comedy and white-knuckle suspense form an icy bond in the second year of Noah Hawley's anthology series. Kirsten Dunst and Patrick Wilson lead a deliciously deadpan ensemble in an escalating bloodbath, where chills and Midwestern cheer fall like a quiet snow.)
2015 Winner AFI Award
TV Program of the Year
(FARGO argues that murder is a dish best served cold - particularly when paired with puckish pathos in Noah Hawley's spin-off of the Coen brothers' classic film. Here, small-town warmth, embodied by Allison Tolman's Deputy Molly Solverson, gives way to the frigid Minnesota winter and the bitter chill of human depravity. Completing this macabre needlepoint are Martin Freeman's milquetoast-turned-murderer and Billy Bob Thornton's hilariously haunting hit man.)
